text: david jolly reporting for the new york
times and international herald tribune
from tokyo today the japanese government
announced that radioactive iodine had
been found in the capital's water supply
and they warned that infants should not
drink the water the level is 210
becquerels per litre a limit for infants
is one hundred becquerels per liter so
this would double what the government
recommends is the maximum for adults the
maximum is 300 there was sort of a run
on bottled water after the announcement
I just came back from interviewing some
convenience store clerks and they said
that within an hour after the
announcement people had just cleared the
shelves of water the chief cabinet
spokesman went on TV and gave a press
conference where he said some fortunate
but sort of inevitable with the water
they're spraying on the reactors up
there to cool them and Fukushima Daiichi
power plant when they do that that gives
off steam the steam is carried away
right now there's rain a sort of a cold
rainy night here in Tokyo
